entityId.localType: ISMAPNG Archives Bathurst Repository Series Number

biogHist.abstract: Record Cards is a series of records created by St Joseph's Orphanage, Bathurst (Girls' Home). The series is made up of photocopies of forty record cards which were passed on to the Sisters of Mercy Archives, Bathurst, in mid-August 2001. The records only relate to girls admitted between May 1962 and July 1968. The orphanage closed in 1975. The information includes: Name; Date of Birth; Date of Admission; Details of Parents; Details of other children in the family; Name(s) of Referee(s); Date of leaving the orphanage and with whom; Where educated.
biogHist.p: Application for access must be made, in writing, to the Archivist, providing personal identification documents to establish the right to access information. Physical access to the records is not permitted due to their fragility and the need to protect the confidentiality of information concerning other persons. Information will be forwarded by mail.

The Record Cards are managed by the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy of Australia and Papua New Guinea (ISMAPNG). ISMAPNG formed out of the consolidation of 14 of the 17 congregations of the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy in Australia, and from the region of Papua New Guinea. This included the Bathurst Congregation, which ran the St Josephs' Orphanage from 1867 until it closed down in 1975.
